summary: This document is an email chain from August 2020 discussing access to a shared American Express Drive folder named "Epstein" that was originally shared in July 2019. The emails show US government personnel attempting to obtain credentials to download original files from an Amex production related to the Epstein case.

events.title: American Express folder "Epstein" shared
events.description: An invitation was sent to view a shared folder named "Epstein" on American Express Drive, with sharing set to expire on July 12, 2020.

events.title: Attempt to access Epstein Amex folder
events.description: US government personnel exchanged emails attempting to obtain American Express credentials to log in and download original files from the "Epstein" folder production.

keyFacts: American Express maintained a shared folder named "Epstein" containing financial records relevant to the investigation.
The folder was originally shared via AmexDrive on July 13, 2019, with sharing set to expire on July 12, 2020.
In August 2020, US government personnel were still attempting to access the original files from this Amex production.
The email chain shows coordination between multiple US government email addresses (with redacted names) to obtain Amex credentials for accessing the financial records.
The document reference EFTA00087950 suggests this is part of a larger document production related to financial investigations in the Epstein case.
